situation.title: Services
situation.meta_description: Rules and recommendations for services for the time of pandemic.

content.processed:
The provision of services in establishments is forbidden. 

The only exceptions are:

  • taxi centres and other similar activities (as of 19. 1. 2021),
  • Psychodiagnostic Assessment Testing centres (as of 9 February 2021)
  • providers of car recovery, breakdown and towing
  • ticket offices,
  • construction and demolition companies, project management for construction, geological work, land surveying, testing, measurement and analysis during construction work,
  • funeral services, embalming and preservation, cremation of human remains, including the placing of human remains in urns,
  • car washes,
  • collection and purchase of raw materials and composting plants,
  • establishments enabling the collection of goods and consignments purchased remotely.

A special exception are taxi centres and other similar activities. They are allowed to operate between 9 PM and 4:59 AM, as well as during public holidays. 

Closed must be:

  • swimming pools, saunas, paddling pools, wellness facilities, solariums or salt caves (if their services are not provided as part of health care)
  • casinos, gambling houses and betting offices
  • fitness center
  • hairdressing, manicure
  • and other services not specified in the exceptions.

The general ban does not apply to activities that are not trades under the Trade Licensing Act.

If an establishment normally provides more than one type of service, at least one of which is now permitted by exception, the establishment may be open. However, the operator may only provide a service permitted under the exceptions in the establishment. It cannot allow public access to the part of the establishment where the prohibited service is provided.

Rules and recommendations

Service establishments which may be open under exceptions must comply with operational and hygiene measures:

  • the premises can be open from 5 AM to 8:59 PM,
  • there may not be more than 1 customer per 15m² of sales area *)  and may be accompanied by a child under 6 years of age. If the establishment is smaller than 15 m², a child under the age of 15 or a holder of a disabled person's card may go in together with 1 customer,
  • ensures that customers maintain the regulated distance of 2 m, unless they are from a common household. 
  • signs with the regulated distance of 2 m must be disposed in the establishment so that people can keep their spacing while waiting in queues
  • the customer who holds a card of a person with a disability has the right of priority purchase,
  • place disinfectants on frequently touched items (especially handles, railings, shopping carts) so customers alongside with staff can use them.
  • ensure that customers are informed of these hygiene and operating rules. You can use information posters or, for example, speakers in the establishment,
  • ensure the maximum possible air circulation with outdoor air intake (ventilation or air conditioning) without air recirculation in the building,
  • promotional activities that must be carried out by human forces on the spot are prohibited
  • a person with a stroller carrying a child does not need a shopping cart for the purchase and the child is not included in the total number of people in the establishment.

*) The sales area, defined for the purposes of restricting the number of people, means the store area accessible to customers including changing rooms, area behind sales counters used by cashier/seller. Store offices and warehouses are not included. It is also mandatory to adopt regime and organizational measures and queue management (in front of and in the shop).

If you use any of the services, follow the hygiene rules. It is mandatory to have the mouth and nose covered with a respirator or other protective device without an exhalation valve with a filtration efficiency of at least 94% (class FFP2 / KN 95). Remember to keep the recommended distance and regularly disinfect/wash your hands, ideally pay cashless. Please be responsible. This way you will protect yourself and others.
 

Pay attention to the new restriction adjusting the free movement of persons which is in force from March 1, 2021. Now, you need a confirmation when you cross the district borders. Learn more about the free movement of persons here.

questions_answers.question: Can I order delivery service or a courier?
questions_answers.value: Yes. You can order goods via the Internet or food delivery.

questions_answers.question: Can I get someone to repair my roof?
Is it possible order a plumber to fix a broken sink?
questions_answers.value: Yes, only in a necessary situation.  You and the repairman are obliged to wear FFP2 or KN95 respirators during the meeting.

questions_answers.question: Can I schedule an appointment with a hairdresser / nail designer / or at the beauty salon?
questions_answers.value: No, you cannot enter the establishment. Keep in mind that these are not essentials. You will protect yourself and your loved ones if you wait to make an appointment with your hairdresser. But if you feel like you in a desperate need for a trim, you can do it at home, try to watch videos online on how to trim your hair.

questions_answers.question: can i make an appointment for cosmetics?
questions_answers.value: No, you cannot enter the establishment. Keep in mind that these are not essentials. You will protect yourself and your loved ones if you wait to make an appointment with your cosmetics.

questions_answers.question: Can I schedule an appointment with a masseur /physiotherapist?
questions_answers.value: Please bear in mind the distinction between a health service (physiotherapy) and a massage. Physiotherapy is not limited in any way, however a massage is prohibited in establishments. Thus, physiotherapists can provide health care as health care providers. Massage and similar relaxation services cannot be provided.

questions_answers.question: Can I order services of a lawyer?
Can I use a TAXI service?
questions_answers.value: Yes. The taxi services are operating as well as public transport, but remember to follow the hygienic measures. You and the driver have a duty to wear a respirator without an exhalation valve with a filtration effectiveness of at least 95% in accordance with the relevant standards (e.g. FFP2/KN 95).
